page.title: 07MR WILDE'S HOUSE,HURSLEY
page.content: A picture painted in 1919 by Mr. Wilde was a beautiful river scene. Outside the {Tudor chimneys }on Mr. Wilde's house lean to the south.Some of the patterns on the chimneys were very unusual but some were more common. Mr.Wilde has a car called a {Tempereno }(built 62 years ago) which is one of the only ones still in existance.When they were made there were only eighty- four produced.The yellow Tempereno looked very old exactly like a"Nody car."The lights were made of carbon. Mr.Wilde had many other{rare lamps which looked very old-fashioned.He kept these under his kitchen table.He also valued his old sewing machine which he kept upstairs.
